data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Christopher Paul Randolph, Sr.
data.text:
Visitation will be held on Saturday, October 6, 2012 from 9-11:00 A.M. at Evangelistic Center, 1811 Washington Blvd., Kansas City, Kansas.

Religious Service will follow at 11:00 A.M. at the Church

Interment: Highland Park Cemetery, Kansas City, Kansas

Christopher Paul Randolph, Sr. was born on March 20, 1971 in Wilmot, Arkansas to Mary Randolph. He was educated in Kansas City, Kansas public schools.

Christopher accepted Christ at an early age and later rededicated his life and was baptized under the leadership of Pastor Seth Harris of St. Andrew Missionary Baptist Church.

Christopher was a skilled Barber for over twenty years. He was good father, his kids meant the world to him. He was a very energetic, outgoing person, who enjoyed hanging around with his family and friends; he loved to play basketball and was a very good artist. Paul was a funny comedian that would have you laughing and he had a beautiful smile that will light up your world. He was employed at Certain Teed Fiber Glass for 8 years.

Christopher was preceded death by his son, Christopher Jr. and Maternal Grandmother, Bertha Miller.

Remaining to cherish his memories are; his mother, Mary Randolph of Kansas City Kansas; his wife, Glenda; his children, Mercedes and Kristal of Tennessee, Christopher III, Cierra, Cameron and Chanel of Kansas City Kansas; his sisters, Lynda, Patrece, Bertha and Ferlisha (David); his brothers, Leroy (Sabrina) and Demetrius (Tiffany) all of Kansas City, Kansas; his seven paternal siblings all of out of state; his aunts, Thelma Tony (Aaron) of Kansas City, Missouri, Jessie Sinclair of Kansas City, Kansas and Etone Island of Bastrop, Louisiana. He also leaves behind his nieces, nephews, cousins and friends.
